title: Aviator in the Amazon: Tales of a Flight Engineer with Pan Am
description: First Person Account of American History:The dangerous life of an early Pan Am Flight Engineer -- of plane crashes, jungle head-hunters, and living on the Amazon.After Prohibition ended, Pan Am was beginning flights to South America where there were numerous dangers. After the start of WWII, rubber became the key element to the US war effort. Flights to the Amazon River became frequent, including long times in the jungle. Yet for a few hardy aviators -- this was a regular routine.
author: Laura Neis
